lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "It would slow growth in Germany and Japan which would adversely affect our trade balance and ultimately it would drive interest rates up here which would throw us, if not (into) recession, into slower growth," he said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Monetary sources said officials were exasperated that the markets, which drove the dollar rapidly lower and severely disrupted bond and stock markets too, did not take heed of the policy commitments of the Group of Seven -- the United States, Japan, West Germany, France, Britain, Italy and Canada.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But there were signs too, that while policymakers feared the market uproar, they seemed to accept there was little they could do until the economic picture changed, and currencies settled into a stable pattern as a result.
